conclusion: Analyzing liquid flow from A, B, C, D through baffles to E, F, G
Four starting points at top (A, B, C, D) and three collection containers at bottom (E, F, G)
Angled baffles in between redirect liquid flow
Liquid from A starts falling straight down
Liquid from A hits blue horizontal baffle in upper section
Blue baffle redirects flow to the right
Liquid from A hits white/gray baffle
White/gray baffle redirects flow downward and slightly to the left
Liquid from A reaches container G
Liquid from B falls straight down
Liquid from B may not hit any baffles directly
Liquid from B continues downward until reaching brown/orange or black baffle
Liquid from B directed toward container F
Liquid from C falls straight down
Liquid from C hits brown horizontal baffle
Brown baffle redirects flow to the left
Liquid from C directed toward container F
Liquid from D falls straight down
Liquid from D hits black horizontal baffle
Black baffle redirects flow to the left
Liquid from D directed toward container E
Liquid from A will flow into container G
Liquid from B will flow into container F
Liquid from C will flow into container F
Liquid from D will flow into container E
